processing module

Contains all the methods like various custom transformers and pipelines to prepare the data for training and testing the model.

class processing.CombinedAttributesAdder(add_bedrooms_per_room=True)

Bases: sklearn.base.BaseEstimator, sklearn.base.TransformerMixin

To add three new attributes using the current available attributes/features/columns in the original dataframe.

BaseEstimator:

Base class for all estimators in scikit-learn

TransformerMixin:

Mixin class for all transformers in scikit-learn.

fit(X, y=None)

To fit the custom Transformer on the given data. Also to calculate the indices of top k elements.

X (pd.DataFrame):

Dataframe of independent variables in a dataset.

y (pd.DataFrame, optional):

Dataframe of depenedent variables in the same dataset as above. Defaults to None.

transform(X, y=None)

To transform the fitted data into a new numpy array containing extra attributes. These attributes are: 1. rooms_per_household 2. population_per_household 3. bedrooms_per_rooms

X (pd.DataFrame):

Dataframe of independent variables in a dataset.

y (pd.DataFrame, optional):

Dataframe of depenedent variables in the same dataset as above. Defaults to None.

numpy.array:

An array containing extra added attributes.

processing.prepare_data(data)

To prepare the data using scikit-learn pipelines. This method performs the following transformations 1. Adds some extra attributes, which are just the

mathematical combinations of the existing attributes in the data, to the end of the data.

  1. Imputes the missing values by taking the median of the values in each column.

  2. Uses standard scaler to scale the numeric values.

  3. Performs one hot encoding on the categorical variables/columns.

  4. Splits the data into dependent(y) and independent(X) variables.

data (pandas.DataFrame):

Data that needs to be prepared.

X_prepared(numpy.array):

The transformed data including extra attributes.

y: The target variable of the data.
